Compute the S3 class of an object

Source: R/s3_class.R
s3_class.Rd

Compared to class(), this always returns the class vector that is used for dispatch. This is most important for objects where the class attribute has not been set.

Usage

s3_class(x)

Arguments

x

A primitive type

Examples

s3_class(NULL)
#> [1] "NULL"

s3_class(logical())
#> [1] "logical"
s3_class(integer())
#> [1] "integer" "numeric"
s3_class(numeric())
#> [1] "double"  "numeric"
s3_class(character())
#> [1] "character"

s3_class(matrix())
#> [1] "matrix"  "logical"
s3_class(matrix(1))
#> [1] "matrix"  "double"  "numeric"

s3_class(array())
#> [1] "array"   "logical"
s3_class(array(1))
#> [1] "array"   "double"  "numeric"
